decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title

Drawing number 013315 32a - Existing basement floor plan, Drawing number 013315 33a - Existing ground floor plan, Drawing number 013315 34a - Existing first floor plan, Drawing number 013315 35a - Existing second floor plan, Drawing number 013315 36a - Existing roof plan, Drawing number 013315 37a - Proposed basement floor plan, Drawing number 013315 38a - Proposed ground floor plan, Drawing number 013315 39a - Proposed first floor plan, Drawing number 013315 40a - Proposed second floor plan, Drawing number 013315 41 - Approved and proposed front elevation, Drawing number 013315 42 - As approved and proposed rear elevation, Drawing number 013315 42a - Existing rear elevation, Drawing number 013315 43a - Existing and proposed right elevation, Drawing number 013315 43 - As approved and proposed right elevation, Drawing number 013315 44 - As approved and proposed left elevation, Drawing number 013315 45 a - Existing and proposed roof plan, Drawing number 013315 51a - Proposed site plan, Drawing number 013315 53 - Bin store, Drawing number 013315 53 - Cycle storage,
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| Cycle storage for eight (8) bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the site, in accordance with Drawing number 013315 51a - Proposed site plan and Drawing number 013315 53 - Cycle storage, within a secure, lockable compound in accordance with all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within an enclosure has been provided within the front garden of the property, in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3 and SI8 of the London Plan (2021).

| The sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications and external amenity areas shall be in accordance with the Council's assessment standards of the SPG10 (including aircraft noise - worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57/60 dB) and achieve compliance with the acoustic noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self noise). The above shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021)

| The basement as shown on the approved plans (condition 2) shall be used for domestic purposes incidental to the enjoyment of ALL of the flats at Fern Bank 2A Golden Manor only and not for any other use. No cooking or kitchen facilities shall be installed into this part of the building at any time.

Reason: To prevent the creation of a separate self-contained residential unit of accommodation in the interests of the living conditions of the existing and future residents of the  site and to ensure that the  use of the building does not, by reason  of  any  other  activity, harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with policies 1.1,1.2 and 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), SPG4, policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document  (2013), policy D6 of  the  London  Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The proposal hereby permitted shall not be occupied until the window to the first floor side elevation and front bay projection at first floor level (facing No 2 Golden Manor) have been fitted with obscured glazing, and no part of that window that is less than 1.7 metres above the floor of the room in which it is installed shall be capable of being opened. Once installed the obscured glazing shall be retained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 2.1 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The hard and soft landscaping shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any of the flats and maintained in perpetuity in accordance with the approved details ref. 183901CND dated 28/01/2019. Any trees or plants which within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of similar size and species.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).
description: Proposed conversion of existing dwelling to 4 no. flats & associated alterations (these include internal changes, changes to the lightwells to basement and changes to openings on roof)
